subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Great Ocean Conveyor Belt
description: A fast breakdown of The Great Ocean Conveyor Belt for builders.

hook.text: A single loop of ocean current takes about 1,000 years to circle the globe. It never stops.

buildup.text: Cold, salty water sinks in the North Atlantic and flows along the ocean floor toward Antarctica.

discovery.text: It slowly rises, warms, and flows back on the surface â€” distributing heat across the planet.

twist.text: This thermohaline circulation drives weather patterns for billions of people.

climax.text: If it slows or stops, Europe could cool dramatically while the tropics overheat.

punchline.text: The slowest current on Earth controls the fastest changes in weather.

quiz.question: How long does it take for water to complete one loop of the conveyor belt?
